notes: All diagnostics and coaching cues are inferred from ball flight only.
No club delivery variables are known with certainty.
Guidance is intended for practice focus, not definitive swing diagnosis.

global_sources.title: Ball Flight and Shot Shape Education
Common Shot Patterns and Wrist Influence

Straight.description: Ball starts near the target line with minimal curvature.

RH: Start line and curvature are both well controlled.
Impact conditions are stable for this shot.
LH: Start line and curvature are both well controlled.
Impact conditions are stable for this shot.

RH: Focus on repeating this motion rather than adding speed.
Keep dispersion tight before changing anything.
Maintain the same setup and tempo.
LH: Focus on repeating this motion rather than adding speed.
Keep dispersion tight before changing anything.
Maintain the same setup and tempo.

quick_checks: Confirm alignment is square to the target.
practice_drills: Hit three balls focusing only on start line.

Slice.description: Ball curves strongly away from the target after launch.

RH: Ball curves significantly to the right.
This pattern is commonly associated with a large start line to curvature mismatch.
LH: Ball curves significantly to the left.
This pattern is commonly associated with a large start line to curvature mismatch.

RH: Prioritize reducing curvature before adding speed.
Work on starting the ball closer to the target line.
Check grip and alignment for consistency.
LH: Prioritize reducing curvature before adding speed.
Work on starting the ball closer to the target line.
Check grip and alignment for consistency.

quick_checks: Confirm alignment is not aimed away from target.
Check ball position is not excessively forward.
practice_drills: Hit half-speed shots focusing on straight starts.
Practice shots with reduced curvature targets.

Hook.description: Ball curves strongly toward the target side after launch.

RH: Ball curves significantly to the left.
This pattern is commonly associated with excessive curvature relative to start line.
LH: Ball curves significantly to the right.
This pattern is commonly associated with excessive curvature relative to start line.

RH: Reduce curvature before increasing swing speed.
Focus on starting the ball closer to center.
Check that grip pressure is not overly strong.
LH: Reduce curvature before increasing swing speed.
Focus on starting the ball closer to center.
Check that grip pressure is not overly strong.

quick_checks: Verify grip is not overly rotated.
practice_drills: Hit controlled shots aiming slightly opposite curve.
